meanings.definition: The act of making someone a layperson.
meanings.sent1: After the laicization, he no longer held a position in the church.
meanings.sent2: The laicization of the priest allowed him to marry and start a family.
meanings.sent3: The laicization ceremony was a joyous occasion for the community.
meanings.sent4: Her laicization was like a butterfly emerging from its cocoon, embracing a new life.
meanings.sent5: The laicization marked a new beginning for him outside the clergy.

meanings.definition: The process of removing someone from the clergy and returning them to lay status.
meanings.sent1: The laicization of the monk was a lengthy procedure.
meanings.sent2: During the laicization, he had to adjust to a different way of life.
meanings.sent3: The laicization paperwork got mixed up with the choir's music sheets.
meanings.sent4: Her laicization felt like stepping out of a shadow into the sunlight of freedom.
meanings.sent5: The laicization was a turning point in his spiritual journey.
